T√≠tulo: Good location but service is disappointing
Conte√∫do: This was my second stay in this vicinity near Ibirapeura Park and I chose this hotel, since it is a Grand Mercure setting. I was very disappointed in the service, especially when compared to aother Grand Mercure hotels in other cities. The room was very nice and spacious, but there was nothing to make it special. The hotel management and staff should learn from the Grand Mercure Hotel Shanghai Zhongya, Shanghai, China as to how a Grand Mercure Hotel should function. Take care of how you use your credit card at this facility, since they will reserve funds for charges to your room, but they don't inform you that it is not cancelled when you check out, but rather after a 5 day waiting period. This was aweful for me, since I had to travel to another city and use my credit card again. Also check that you don't pay for both room and federal taxes. Nothing of this is properly explained when you check in. Especially not in English. Some staff members were able to communicte in English, but it is only functional. The room has a bar fridge for use, but there is no kettle to make your own tea for leisure or an iron for your shirts. Breakfast was even more disappointing, as the service is non-existent. The waiters only clean your table when it suits them, and not when you are done with a dish. They don't even offer to fill-up your cup or glass when it is empty. I would suggest that the waiters get proper training as to how to wait on guests at this hotel. The food was average and is a set buffet, with no option of a chef to make you a simple omelette.
